content:
Yes, several countries have started implementing new border strategies in response to the Delta variant. Some of the measures include:

1. Australia: Australia has tightened its border controls, imposing a stricter travel ban and requiring returning residents to quarantine for 14 days.

2. Japan: Japan has extended its state of emergency and implemented stricter border controls, including a ban on travelers from Bangladesh, Indonesia, Nepal, and the Maldives.

3. Indonesia: Indonesia has implemented stricter border controls, including mandatory quarantine for all travelers.

4. Thailand: Thailand has implemented a new control system for international arrivals, including mandatory quarantine and required medical insurance coverage for COVID-19.

5. United States: The United States has put restrictions on travel from certain countries and requires negative COVID-19 test results for all international travelers.

6. United Kingdom: The United Kingdom has introduced a traffic light system for international travel, with varying levels of quarantine and testing requirements based on the risk level of the country.

It is important to note that the situation is constantly evolving, and countries' responses may change as more information becomes available.
